tit.e: Heizei-gojo (a term composed of four kanji characters representing an essential doctrine of Jodo Shinshu Buddhism)
tit.cmt: 用語の検索・登録では、「平生業成」は"Heizei-gogyo"と訳されています。
tit.e: Heizei-gojo (a term composed of four kanji characters representing an essential doctrine of Jodo Shinshu Buddhism)
Heizei-gojo (a term composed of four kanji characters representing an essential doctrine of Jodo Shinshu Buddhism)

sen.j: 平生業成（へいぜいごうじょう）は、「平生に業事成弁（生きている平生に、往生の業事が、完成（成弁）する）」という意味の浄土真宗の言葉である。
sen.e: "Heizei-gojo" is a Buddhist term of Jodo Shinshu Buddhism (the True Pure Land Buddhism,) which means that any person must complete preparation for rebirth in heaven while he is still alive.

sen.j: これは、親鸞の開いた浄土真宗の教義を漢字4字で表したものである。
sen.e: This term is composed of four kanji (Chinese characters) representing the essential doctrine of Jodo Shinshu founded by a priest, Shinran.

sen.j: 「平生業成」と聞くと、平生の行いのように使われる場合があるが、誤用である。
sen.e: Sometimes, however, the term "Heizei Gojo" is mistakenly used as to imply ordinary behaviors of any person.

sen.j: 浄土真宗の教えは、念仏を称えたら死んだら極楽へゆけるものと誤解されている場合が多くある。
sen.e: The doctrine of Jodo Shinshu is often misunderstood that any person may go to gokuraku (the Buddhist paradise) after his death only if he repeats recitation of nenbutsu (the Buddhist invocation) while he is alive.

sen.e: But the doctrine implies that any person may be rescued right now while he lives, as the term "Heizei-gojo" explains.
